skill.name: flow-nexus-swarm
skill.description: Cloud-based AI swarm deployment and event-driven workflow automation with Flow Nexus platform
skill.summary: Cloud-based AI swarm deployment and event-driven workflow automation with Flow Nexus platform
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation describing how to use the external Flow Nexus MCP server. No executable code, scripts, file system access, network calls, or environment variable access exists within the skill file itself. All functionality is provided through documented MCP tool calls to the external Flow Nexus platform.

content.value_statement: Managing multiple AI agents across complex workflows requires coordination, scalability, and reliable message passing between components. Flow Nexus Swarm provides cloud-based orchestration with event-driven workflows, pre-built templates, and intelligent agent assignment to scale agent deployments from single tasks to enterprise-grade multi-swarm systems.
actual_capabilities: Initialize AI agent swarms with hierarchical, mesh, ring, or star topologies
Spawn specialized agents for research, coding, analysis, optimization, and coordination
Create and execute event-driven workflows with parallel execution and dependencies
Use pre-built templates for full-stack dev, research, CI/CD, and data pipelines
Monitor swarm status, workflow metrics, and execution audit trails
Scale agent counts dynamically and coordinate multiple swarms for complex projects
limitations: Requires separate Flow Nexus MCP server installation and active account
All execution happens on Flow Nexus cloud infrastructure, not locally
Agent limits and features depend on the Flow Nexus service tier
No local code execution or file system access within the skill itself

use_cases.title: Full-Stack Delivery
use_cases.description: Coordinate backend, frontend, database, and QA agents through parallel workflows with dependency management.

use_cases.title: CI/CD Automation
use_cases.description: Automate testing, building, security scanning, and multi-environment deployment with rollback support.

use_cases.title: Distributed Research
use_cases.description: Deploy mesh topology swarms for parallel information gathering and collaborative data analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Swarm Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Initialize a hierarchical swarm with 6 agents using the balanced strategy, then spawn a coordinator, two coders, an analyst, and an optimizer.

prompt_templates.title: Workflow Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a workflow called Production Deploy with steps for linting, unit tests, build, security scan, and deployment. Configure exponential backoff retry with max 3 retries.

prompt_templates.title: Task Orchestration
prompt_templates.prompt: Orchestrate this task across 4 agents in parallel: Research the latest developments in quantum computing and analyze their implications for software security.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Swarm Coordination
prompt_templates.prompt: Initialize three coordinated swarms: a mesh research swarm with 3 agents, a hierarchical development swarm with 6 agents, and a star testing swarm with 4 agents. Create a workflow that links them sequentially.

output_examples.input: Initialize a mesh swarm with 4 agents and spawn specialized agents for a data analysis project.
output: ‚úì Swarm initialized: mesh topology, 4 agents, balanced strategy

best_practices: Start with simple topologies and increase complexity as you verify the workflow structure works correctly.
Define clear dependencies between workflow steps to ensure proper execution order and parallelize independent tasks.
Use the vector similarity matching option when assigning agents to optimize task-agent fit based on capability analysis.
anti_patterns: Avoid spawning more agents than needed without monitoring - excessive agents increase coordination overhead and cost.
Do not create complex workflows without proper error handling, retry policies, and timeout configurations.
Avoid skipping resource cleanup - always destroy swarms and workflows when they are no longer needed.

faq.question: Which AI tools are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through the Flow Nexus MCP server interface.

faq.question: What are the agent and workflow limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your Flow Nexus service tier. Check flow-nexus.ruv.io for pricing and quotas.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing Claude Flow setups?
faq.answer: Yes. Flow Nexus integrates with Claude Flow hooks for pre-task and post-task coordination.

faq.question: Is my data safe with cloud-based execution?
faq.answer: Flow Nexus processes data on their cloud infrastructure. Review their privacy policy for compliance requirements.

faq.question: Why are my workflows failing?
faq.answer: Check agent availability, verify dependency configurations, and ensure retry policies are set for transient failures.

faq.question: How does this compare to local agent coordination?
faq.answer: Flow Nexus provides scalable cloud infrastructure for large swarms. Use local execution for smaller tasks with claude-flow.
